name: Trimmomatic
author: UNKNOWN
description: It works with FASTQ (using phred + 33 or phred + 64 quality scores, depending on the Illumina pipeline used), either uncompressed or gzipp'ed FASTQ. Use of gzip format is determined based on the .gz extension. For single-ended data, one input and one output file are specified, plus the processing steps. For paired-end data, two input files are specified, and 4 output files, 2 for the paired output where both reads survived the processing, and 2 for corresponding unpaired output where a read survived, but the partner read did not.

commands.name: trimmomatic
commands.description: It works with FASTQ (using phred + 33 or phred + 64 quality scores, depending on the Illumina pipeline used), either uncompressed or gzipp'ed FASTQ. Use of gzip format is determined based on the .gz extension. For single-ended data, one input and one output file are specified, plus the processing steps. For paired-end data, two input files are specified, and 4 output files, 2 for the paired output where both reads survived the processing, and 2 for corresponding unpaired output where a read survived, but the partner read did not.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: For single-ended data, one input and one output file are specified, plus the processing steps. For paired-end data, two input files are specified, and 4 output files, 2 for the 'paired' output where both reads survived the processing, and 2 for corresponding 'unpaired' output where a read survived, but the partner read did not.

parameters.name: threads
parameters.description: indicates the number of threads to use, which improves performance on multi-core computers. If not specified, it will be chosen automatically

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: phred + 33 or phred + 64 quality scores

parameters.name: trimlog
parameters.description:
specifies the path to the log file. Log file contains info as : 
-the read name
-the surviving sequence length
-the location of the first surviving base, aka. the amount trimmed from the start
-the location of the last surviving base in the original read-
the amount trimmed from the end

parameters.name: inputFile1
parameters.description: Specifies the path to the fastq input file.

parameters.name: basein
parameters.description: Specifies the path to the fastq input file.

parameters.name: pairedInput1
parameters.description: Specifies the path to the input file 1 of paired mode.

parameters.name: pairedInput2
parameters.description: Specifies the path to the input file 2 of paired mode.

parameters.name: baseout
parameters.description: Specifies the path to the fastq input file.

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: Specifies the name of output file.

parameters.name: pairedOutput1
parameters.description: Specifies the name of paired output file 1.

parameters.name: unpairedOutput1
parameters.description: Specifies the name of unpaired output file 1.

parameters.name: pairedOutput2
parameters.description: Specifies the name of paired output file 2.

parameters.name: unpairedOutput2
parameters.description: Specifies the name of unpaired output file 2.

parameters.name: ILLUMINA_CLIP
parameters.description: This step is used to find and remove Illumina adapters.

sub_parameters.name: fastaWithAdaptersEtc
sub_parameters.description: Specifies the path to a fasta file containing all the adapters, PCR sequences etc. The naming of the various sequences within this file determines how they are used.

sub_parameters.name: seedMismatches
sub_parameters.description: Specifies the maximum mismatch count which will still allow a full match to be performed.

sub_parameters.name: palindromeClipThreshold
sub_parameters.description: Specifies how accurate the match between the two 'adapter ligated' reads must be for PE palindrome read alignment.

sub_parameters.name: simpleClipThreshold
sub_parameters.description: Specifies how accurate the match between any adapter etc. sequence must be against a read.

sub_parameters.name: minAdapterLength
sub_parameters.description: In addition to the alignment score, palindrome mode can verify that a minimum length of adapter has been detected. If unspecified, this defaults to 8 bases, for historical reasons. However, since palindrome mode has a very low false positive rate, this can be safely reduced, even down to 1, to allow shorter adapter fragments to be removed.

sub_parameters.name: keepBothReads
sub_parameters.description: After read-though has been detected by palindrome mode, and the adapter sequence removed, the reverse read contains the same sequence information as the forward read, albeit in reverse complement. For this reason, the default behaviour is to entirely drop the reverse read. By specifying „true‟ for this parameter, the reverse read will also be retained, which may be useful e.g. if the downstream tools cannot handle a combination of paired and unpaired reads.

parameters.name: SLIDINGWINDOW
parameters.description: Perform a sliding window trimming, cutting once the average quality within the window falls below a threshold. By considering multiple bases, a single poor quality base will not cause the removal of high quality data later in the read.

sub_parameters.name: windowSize
sub_parameters.description: Specifies the number of bases to average across.

parameters.name: MAXINFO
parameters.description: Performs an adaptive quality trim, balancing the benefits of retaining longer reads against the costs of retaining bases with errors.

sub_parameters.name: targetLength
sub_parameters.description: This specifies the read length which is likely to allow the location of the read within the target sequence to be determined.

sub_parameters.name: strictness
sub_parameters.description: This value, which should be set between 0 and 1, specifies the balance between preserving as much read length as possible vs. removal of incorrect bases. A low value of this parameter (<0.2) favours longer reads, while a high value (>0.8) favours read correctness.

parameters.name: leadingQuality
parameters.description: Specifies the minimum quality required to keep a base.

parameters.name: trailingQuality
parameters.description: Specifies the minimum quality required to keep a base.

parameters.name: cropLength
parameters.description: The number of bases to keep, from the start of the read.

parameters.name: headcropLength
parameters.description: The number of bases to remove from the start of the read.

parameters.name: minlenLength
parameters.description: Specifies the minimum length of reads to be kept.

parameters.name: topHred33
parameters.description: Specifies the minimum length of reads to be kept.

parameters.name: topHred64
parameters.description: Specifies the minimum length of reads to be kept.
